item.title: Theme Documentation - Basics
item.author: Bard
item.description: Discover what the Hugo - LoveIt theme is all about and the core-concepts behind it.

item.title: Theme Documentation - Content
item.author: Bard
item.description: Find out how to create and organize your content quickly and intuitively in LoveIt theme.

item.title: Theme Documentation - Built-in Shortcodes
item.author: Bard
item.description: Hugo provides multiple built-in shortcodes for author convenience and to keep your markdown content clean.

item.title: Factory Pattern
item.author: Bard
item.description: The Factory Method pattern is a creational design pattern that provides a way to delegate the creation of objects to subclasses. In the Factory Method pattern, an abstract factory class defines an interface for creating objects, but the specific object creation is deferred to the subclasses. Simple Factory Pattern The Simple Factory pattern, also known as the Static Method pattern, defines a static method in the object creation factory class to create objects.

item.title: Maximum Size of Connected Components
item.author: Bard
item.description: Problem Description Given an n×m 2D integer array representing a maze, where the array contains only 0s and 1s, with 0 representing a path that can be traversed and 1 representing an impassable wall. Initially, there is a person at the top-left corner (1, 1). It is known that the person can move one position in any direction: up, down, left, or right. The task is to determine the minimum number of moves required for the person to reach the bottom-right corner (n, m).

item.title: Maximum Size of Connected Components
item.author: Bard
item.description: Problem Description Given a tree with n nodes (numbered 1 to n) and n-1 undirected edges. Please find the centroid of the tree and output the maximum number of nodes in each remaining connected component after removing the centroid. Centroid Definition: The centroid of a tree is a node such that if it is removed, the maximum number of nodes in each remaining connected component is minimized. Input Format The first line contains an integer n, representing the number of nodes in the tree.

item.title: Theme Documentation - Extended Shortcodes
item.author: Bard
item.description: LoveIt theme provides multiple shortcodes on top of built-in ones in Hugo.

item.title: Basic Markdown Syntax
item.author: Bard
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files.

item.title: Maximum Non-overlapping Intervals
item.author: Bard
item.description: Problem Description Given N closed intervals [ai, bi], you need to select a subset of intervals on the number line such that the selected intervals do not overlap with each other (including the endpoints). Output the maximum number of intervals that can be selected. Input Format The first line contains an integer N, representing the number of intervals. The next N lines contain two integers ai and bi each, representing the endpoints of an interval.

item.title: Theme Documentation - mermaid Shortcode
item.author: Bard
item.description: The mermaid shortcode supports diagrams in Hugo with Mermaid library.
